fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

I was added to a PR for the NotificationsComponent.  At first I didn't remember what it was, so I looked at the package and read the README.md, but it is the boilerplate that is autogenerated when adding a package.

Fortunately, I had just spent some time with Disco and remembered what it was.

The README.md really should be filled out though so that other developers can figure out what's going on in the package.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Read README.md in app-navigation

h3. Expected Results

- Gain knowledge of app-navigation
h3. Actual Results

- No knowledge gained
h3. Workaround

Could look through some design docs, but that isn't the same as info about the code and there doesn't appear to be a clear way to find out who owns the module other than tracing the names of people who made edits.
fields.summary: The README.md should be filled out for app-navigation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Confluence, when the user has a table with simple text words and auto-converted page URLs, the alphabetical sorting will organize the order separating the texts from the converted URLs.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence, make sure to create a blank page and add a table to it.
# Add some words with text and paste some existing page URLs in different rows
# Publish the page
# Tap the button to sort the table order alphabetically

h3. Expected Results
The order should respect the alphabetical configuration.

h3. Actual Results
The words with text only will come first, and then, the pages converted from URLs, causing the order to not be respected. This also affects texts linking to a different URL:

!tables.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Currently, the closest workaround would be to add a letter/word in text inside the same row as the converted page URL.
fields.summary: Sorting view alphabetically does properly for tables with text and auto-converted URLs

fields.description:
This has been and continues to be a serious weakness of Confluence and Hipchat.

Confluence is used heavily by software teams. Software teams speak in sentences mixed with code. Forcing us to use code blocks that break the flow of a sentence is a really poor flow.

Slack gets this 100% right. I can type:
{quote}We should really consider using `const toolpane =` instead of using `var toolpane =` when we don't expect the variable to change
{quote}
That should just work. Meaning it will auto-format my inline code snippets. It works on Slack. It works on Github. It is high-time it works on Confluence as well. 

Anything less is just a bad experience. I haven't met a single person yet who disagrees with that.

I recently onboarded 25 people to Confluence. And damn, every single technical person struggled with this. Such friction!

Why not support this? Why force us into the slow, annoying macro workflow. Just follow the rest of the software world and let us use ` and ```.

 

*Atlassian Status as of August 2018*

Since we've started to gradually roll out a new editing experience, we've addressed this as part of the new experience and you can learn more about it by following these links:
 * https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html)
 * https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/keyboard-shortcuts-markdown-and-autocomplete-724764956.html) 

Please let us know if you have any feedback!

Confluence Product Management
fields.summary: Support inline code blocks like Github and Slack

fields.description:
Users see a blank page with mobile browser if anonymous access is enabled
h3. Issue Summary

A blank page is shown on a mobile browser if anonymous access is enabled.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable anonymous access in the global permission, but not each space
 # Browse a page with a mobile browser

h3. Expected Results

The user will be redirected to the login page.
h3. Actual Results

A blank page like below is shown. There is no console error.
 !IMG_2248.PNG|thumbnail!
  

I confirmed that this occurs mobile safari and mobile chrome.

This bug is reproducible by also using Chrome device simulator like this [^画面収録 2019-12-16 18.05.47.mov] .

[https://developers.google.com/web/tools/chrome-devtools/device-mode]

"Something went wrong" error occurs when open the page with desktop Chrome.
 !スクリーンショット 2019-12-19 15.32.17.png|thumbnail!
 * Console error
{code:java}
Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 403 ()
PageTreeController.js:504 PageTree error Object
(anonymous) @ PageTreeController.js:504
/wiki/rest/recentlyviewed/1.0/recent/spaces:1 Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 401 ()
tslib.es6.js:71 Uncaught (in promise) Objectcode: 401reason: ""__proto__: Object
/wiki/rest/recentlyviewed/1.0/recent:1 Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 401 ()
{code}

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Gallery macro does not load images from the page that has "|" in its title

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make a page "test |" and "test"
# Add images to both of the pages
# In a third page, add the Gallery macro and specify both of the pages

h3. Expected Results
The images from both of the pages will load

h3. Actual Results
Only the image from "test" will load 

h3. Workaround
Remove the "|" from the page title
fields.summary: Gallery macro does not load images from the page that has "|" in its title

fields.description: We use Confluence for documentation in our company. Sometimes articles would be useful in multiple spaces. It would be nice if we could tag an article to multiple spaces so that an update in one area would show up in all areas. Right now folks are just cloning the articles to their spaces.
fields.summary: Allow articles to be shared between spaces

fields.description:
In the new Confluence editor, we are no longer allowed to put and Expands macro inside of an excerpts macro.  This was working in the old Confluence editor.

*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Create or Edit and new editor page in confluence cloud
 # Add an excerpt macro
 # put your cursor in the excerpt macro
 # add an expands macro

*Expected results:*

Expands macro box is created inside the excerpts macro .

*Results:*

Expands macro box is created outside of the excerpts macro.
fields.summary: Allow for Expands macro to nest inside Excerpts Macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user tries to use the Companion App +_using Safari in macOS Catalina 10.15.2_+ the installation is not recognized by the browser. This causes Confluence to keep asking for the application to be installed.

!image.png!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access Confluence with Safari 
 # Try to install/use the Companion app

h3. Expected Results

The installation is recognized and file edit works. If already installed, the Companion app is recognized.
h3. Actual Results

Confluence keeps asking for the Companion to be installed
h3. Workaround

Use *Firefox* or *Chrome* to interact with the Companion App (+_Firefox 71.0 and Chrome 79.0.3945.88 have been tested_+)
fields.summary: Using the Companion App with Safari on macOS Catalina does not work

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, in Slack, a very short detail is given for a page that has been shared. 

h3. Proposed Solution

Provide a way to preview the content of the shared Confleucne page via Slack rather than redirecting to Confluence Site.
fields.summary: Preview Shared Confluence Page via Slack

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When pasting a link from Google drive a preview is supposed to show up asking to provide Atlassian app the permission to access the data on Google drive Doc: 
When the permission is granted, the preview is supposed to show the link name and don't ask anymore for the permission. 
However, after further tests, it was identified that links pasted from Google Drive works as expected but links pasted from *Google Team Drive shares* are *NOT*. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Copy a shareable Google Team Drive link 
#*    !スクリーンショット 2019-12-18 18.00.49.png|thumbnail! 
# Paste it in a editing page
# The following message will show up: 
#*   !スクリーンショット 2019-12-18 18.04.59.png|thumbnail! 
# You click on the link and you provide the necessary permission.   
#*   !スクリーンショット 2019-12-18 18.06.06.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* The permission is granted and the file name shows up: 

h3. Actual Results
* Nothing happens for links from Google Team Drive shares. However it works as expected for links from Google Drive. 
 !スクリーンショット 2019-12-18 18.07.14.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When I paste a Google Drive link I'm continuously asked to provide "permissions to view" and nothing happen

fields.description:
Please add an ability to place an image inside the *Info Panel* macro used in the new editor.

When I insert an image into the *Info Panel* macro, it's placed below the macro, not inside it.

!image-2019-12-18-11-45-53-641.png!
fields.summary: [New editor] Add ability to add image to Info Panel macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
All inline attachments on the fabric renderer shows the error page "Something went wrong. It must be a hiccup." This is reproducible for multiple document types.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Open PF Hello on web
# Step 2 Create a page 
# Step 3 Attach an attachment inline (use a variety of types)
# Step 4 Publish it
# Step 5 Open the same page on mobile
# Step 6 Tap on the attachment

h3. Expected Results
The attachment will render in MVNG

h3. Actual Results
There's an error that says "Something went wrong" with a black corrupted file icon.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Inline attachments not rendering on fabric renderer

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Various Jira gadget macros are not present in the macro autocomplete or the macro browser. Notable examples are the Jira pie chart gadget macro and the Two Dimensional Filter Macro Gadget.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page
 # Attempt to insert a Jira pie chart gadget macro or a Jira Two Dimensional Filter Macro Gadget.

h3. Expected Results

Jira macros are available for selection in the macro autocomplete or macro browser
h3. Actual Results

The macros are not present in the autocomplete results or the macro browser.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira Gadget Macros Unavailable in Macro Browser

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Similar to [CONFCLOUD-66969|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-66969], if the user restricts a blog for groups with an uppercase letter, members of the group will not be able to find the blog in a page with the Blog Posts macro.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As a *site-admin* of the application, make sure to create a new group that will be using uppercase letters through [https://site.atlassian.net/admin]. For example, "testiNG".
# With the created group (and also, the *Application Access* granted for it, if needed), make sure to add specific users to the same.
# Add group restriction to a blog with the above group.
# Create a new page and add the *Blog Posts* macro to display the specific blog.
# Ask one of the group members to access the above page with the macro on it.

h3. Expected Results
The person from the group should be able to view the blog in the list of the Blog Posts macro

h3. Actual Results
The person from the group does not see the blog in the Blog Posts macro.

h3. Workaround
Add the user in restriction individually, or add the user to a lowercase group.
fields.summary: Restricted blogs do not display in Blog Posts macro

fields.description: I've spent an increasing amount of times answer questions from users who are trying to access pages when they aren't logged in and it's just listing it as a restricted space. Our cloud instance does not allow anonymous viewing, so a user must always log in to view information. But there's no clear indicator to inexperienced users that they're not logged in if not prompted - which is SUPER annoying as an admin. I'm wondering if something changed, because this has only been an issue recently.
fields.summary: Confluence should prompt a log-in when not logged in users try to access page

fields.description:
Please provide inline code blocks in Jira confluence as statet at CONFCLOUD-57638:

Dear Atlassian support,

I am an IT apprentice at Hapag-Lloyd since 3 months, an organisation currently starting to use your Confluence software products a lot for code documentation purposes with > 300 IT employees and using your Jira application for agile sprint planning.

 

Since the beginning of my computer science courses, I learned writing in markdown standards, as many colleagues of mine, so I quickly document code blocks in our mail software, notebooks, Stackoverflow and GitLab like this:

 

This is how I document an `inline code block`.

 

```java

This is how I document a code block with Java-specific syntax highlighting.

```

 

The feature to enter *inline code blocks* sourrounded by single back ticks would come in really handy for me if it was implemented into your software product too as it is still not implemented.

 

I guess many people worldwide using your products would be profiting from this little change and increase general productivity.

 

Please provide a solution for both Jira and Confluence.

 

I'd really like to promote the implementation of this feature.

 

Thank you very much!

 

Kind regards from Hamburg,

Fabian Rudolf
fields.summary: Please re-open & assign CONFCLOUD-57638

fields.description:
Customers should have the ability to add specific background images to a page, such as one that could serve as a watermark

By adding the watermark to a page, users may be notified about the pages use, such as sensitive data, obsolete page, draft page etc...
fields.summary: Background image (watermark) for pages

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a session timeout has been configured and SSO via SAML has been configured, the sessions do not timeout gracefully. End-users are presented with a 403 response when trying to access Atlassian Cloud content. The expectation is that end-users would be presented with a login page that would allow them to be able to log back in and continue working.
h3. Environment
 * SSO via SAML configured
 * Session timeout configured

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log in to Atlassian services using SSO via SAML
 # Wait for the session to timeout

h3. Expected Results
 * The session times out gracefully and users are redirected to Atlassian account the login page(or the IdP login page)

h3. Actual Results
 * After the session times out, the users are not redirected to the login page when accessing Cloud URLs
 * Sometimes, end-users are getting an 'HTTP Status 403 - Forbidden' error
 !Screen Shot 2019-11-13 at 9.53.12 am.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
 * At this point, it's unconfirmed whether or not end-users should be redirected to the requested page, but should be possible
 * Testing had shown that if SSO via SAML is not configured, then users are redirected to the Atlassian account login page as expected

h3. Workaround
Option 1 :  Clear browser site data for Atlassian services - e.g. for Chrome: chrome://settings/siteData, filter and clear the site data for Atlassian sites
Option 2 : Login via https://start.atlassian.com/ and then access the Confluence site.
fields.summary: After session timed out, the users are not redirected to login page when accessing Cloud URLs

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Removing the last contributor from the search page by clicking the 'x' on their name leads to a "Something's gone wrong" page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Perform a search
 # Add a single user to Contributors
 # Click the 'x' on that user to remove them again

h3. Expected Results
An empty list of contributors.

h3. Actual Results
{quote}
Something's gone wrong

Our team has been notified. If the problem persists, please contact Atlassian Support and be sure to give them this code: mqpff2.
{quote}

h3. Workaround

Click the field-level 'X' instead to clear.
fields.summary: Removing the last contributor from the search page leads to a "Something's gone wrong" page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user drags and drops a file onto a page without the "add attachments" permission the page appears to upload the file but doesn't

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In any space, change the permissions so that you have the view page, create page, and administer space permissions and no other permissions.
 # on any page, drag and drop an image directly onto the page to attempt to upload the image as an attachment to the page. (you do not need to edit the page for this)

h3. Expected Results
An error indicating a lack of permissions to upload attachments shows up, and the image is not indicated as being uploaded. Alternatively, nothing happens.

h3. Actual Results
The attachment modal is shown and the progress bar progresses to 100%. Some users see an error message, others get no error in the UI, but the modal simply persists and does nothing. The modal can be exited.

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround.
fields.summary: drag and drop a file onto a page without the add attachments permission appears to upload the file but doesn't

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When working with tables in the new editor, if we change the size of a single column (it can be a slight change), even if the table doesn't have any content, it will behave like if it has and a horizontal scrollbar will be shown in the published mode.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and insert a table;
# Let the table (or the page) in full-width;
# Change the size of a single column;
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The table is shown as expected.

h3. Actual Results
The table gets a horizontal scrollbar, like if the table has too much content on it.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Tables in full-width, independent of their content, get a horizontal scrollbar if we edit a column size in the published mode

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an image is inserted inside any given layout style column, the image alignment options disappear. This effectively disables the possibility of aligning images inside layouts in a sensitive manner.

!image-2019-12-16-15-10-44-874.png|width=423,height=229!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page
 # Insert any layout option
 # Upload the image
 # Insert it into one of the layout columns

h3. Expected Results

All the alignment options are present and usable.
h3. Actual Results

There are no alignment controls present to the images inside the layout
h3. Workaround

Do not insert images inside layouts.

or

Select all available text on the layout columns with CMD+A or CTRL+A and then use the text alignment tool at the top tool bar.
fields.summary: Attaching images inside a layout section disables the alignment controls

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unlicensed Users can't access Confluence Spaces

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In an instance with *Jira Service Desk* and *Confluence*, create a Service Desk Project
# Configure this project with a KB (Space from Confluence)
# Enable *Unlicensed User Access* for that space
# Invite a customer (without Atlassian Account) to your Service Desk project
# Ask this customer to login to Service Desk
# Try to access the KB space linked

h3. Expected Results
User is able to access the space

h3. Actual Results
User is requested to login to the instance with an Atlassian Account

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unlicensed Users required to Login to Use Confluence

fields.description: Is it possible to embed a playlist (spotify or google play music) in a page? It would be useful for our music pages!
fields.summary: Ability to embed playlist on Confluence page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

With the current Confluence Question permissions, you can only change the global permissions for CQ. This affects who is able to use Questions globally, but not per space.
h3. Suggested Solution

Admins don't necessarily want users to be able to ask questions in any space, so there should be some way to disable CQ on a single space.
h3.
fields.summary: As an admin, disable Questions on a particular Space

fields.description:
The Widget macro only supports full YouTube URL (e.g.: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dQw4w9WgXcQ) but not YouTube shortened links (e.g.: https://youtu.be/dQw4w9WgXcQ)

The links can be generated by right clicking any YouTube video and choose "Copy video URL" or "Copy video URL at current time". 

Right now, we would have to manually convert the URL to the long one (by changing the URL by hand or opening the link to get the expanded URL) then put it in the Widget macro.
fields.summary: Support for youtu.be URL in Widget macro

fields.description:
Anchors automatically rendered with the page name in front of the anchor, eg #anchor name becomes #page-anchor name. This was done in Confluence 2.0 to fix anchor links in space PDF exports.

Unfortunately, this has the side effect of breaking anchor links on pages which are included via the {include} or {excerpt-include} macro in a different Confluence page.
fields.summary: Anchor links to the current page break when included in a different page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Jira Roadmap macro Pre-populates the first project that the user has access to after providing URL which includes classic projects which cannot have a roadmap. The Dropdown will not show these projects, however, this means that the likelihood of the user getting the error message as the first view of the add-on is extremely high in mixed project type environments.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # have a mix of projects, or a list of projects that are mostly classic projects. No Next gen projects is ideal.
 # Create a Next-Gen project with a name that is not likely to show up near the top of the list of projects.
 # In any confluence page, add the Jira Roadmap macro, and supply your test instance as the instance URL.

h3. Expected Results

The project that is pre-populated is a valid option.

h3. Actual Results

The first project result that the user has access to will be returned, even if it is not valid for this macro.

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround other than to manually set the project.
fields.summary: Jira Roadmap macro Pre-populates classic projects that the user has access to after providing URL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Confluence, when the [Recently updated macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/recently-updated-macro-724765272.html] is added to a page, there will have a *Show More* button in order to expand the results. When tapping this button, it will redirect the user to a different page without the correct formatting, as the example below:

 !show_more.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure to perform activities in a space (e.g. create pages, edit page, upload attachments)
# Create a different page in the same space.
# Add the Recently Updated Macro with default settings.
# Tap the *Show More* button on the bottom of the results from the macro

h3. Expected Results

The macro results should be expanded in the page, or, properly redirect the user to a different Confluence page.

h3. Actual Results

It redirects the user to a different URL in Confluence, like:
{code}
https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/recently-updated/changes.action?theme=concise&startIndex=15&searchToken=1&spaceKeys=SPACEKEY&contentType=-mail,page,comment,blogpost,attachment,userinfo,spacedesc,personalspacedesc,space,draft,custom
{code}

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Recently Updated macro's "Show More" option not working properly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Typing $ while editing a template does not add nor display a list of template variables

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit or Create a template using the new editor;
# Insert a variable into the template by:
#* Clicking the *+* button on the top bar > *<> New Variable*
# Now type $ to list variables(as suggested on [Blueprints and User Created Templates|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/blueprints-and-user-created-templates-724764985.html]):

{quote}Type $ and the variable name, then press Enter to add a new variable or to select an existing variable from a list of suggestions. The suggestions dialog shows variables already defined in this template.{quote}
h3. Expected Results
* Once you typed *$* a list of template variables would pop up

h3. Actual Results
* No variable list is displayed and just a sad *$* is inserted into the page
* You also won't be able to add a new variable by typing *$*; 

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Typing $ to create or list template variables does not work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a page is imported using *Replace the Existing page* option, the images added to the page don't get imported and an error *InlineExtension* is displayed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Select the option *Import Word Document* 
* Import the Doc File with images
* From *Import Word Document: Configuration*
* Select *Replace A Page*  option
* Click *Import*

h3. Expected Results
* Page gets imported with all the images

h3. Actual Results
* Page gets imported without images with *InlineExtension* error.

h3. Workaround

* Using Option *Import as a new page in the current space*
fields.summary: Image not displayed during Import using Replace option

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you try to move an attachment from a page to a new one that haves a colon ( : ) in the title, Confluence will not allow you to do it. 

h3. Steps To Reproduce

* Create a page with Colon in the title (e.g. Child#05: TEST)
* Navigate to another page for eg *A* in the same space with Attachments
* Click on *Attachments*, to list all the Attachments on the page
* Click on Properties
* Provide the Name of the Page as *Child#05: TEST* where we want to move the Attachments from page *A*
* Click *Save*

h3. Expected Behaviour

* Selected Attachment will be moved to the mentioned Page

h3. Actual Result

* End up in the following error message:

{noformat}
You cannot move the attachment to a page that does not exist. Pages to which you are moving attachments must first be created in the selected space.
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

* Remove the colon from the title of the destination page.
fields.summary: Unable to Move Attachments to Pages Having a Colon in Title

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Confluence Cloud permits group names with a slash in them. Ex: "foo/bar". However, when using the "group" API resource, groups cannot be fetched by name when they have a slash. Ex: "https://foo.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/experimental/group/foo/bar". Nor does the method support URL encoded slashes like "foo%2Fbar"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # From the admin section, create a group named 'foo/bar"
 # From the browser, navigate to: "https://yourinstance/wiki/rest/experimental/group/foo/bar" or "https://yourinstance/wiki/rest/experimentsl/group/foo%2Fbar"

h3. Expected Results

Successful API response with group info in JSON
h3. Actual Results

400 bad request

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: group API method cannot fetch group names with a slash

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It seems that it is possible to connect to the editor twice in the same tab. This causes the editor to endlessly repeat any input into the editor page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 The issue is intermittent and the exact parameters required are not known.
# edit the page.

h3. Expected Results
The editor opens normally

h3. Actual Results

The editor opens showing that you are connected twice and any input is repeated endlessly.

h3. Workaround

Reload the editor page.
fields.summary: It is possible to connect to the editor twice in the same tab

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Confluence Cloud mobile app does not allow users to bypass certificate errors. In the Jira Cloud mobile app, the user is redirected to the device's native web browser where a security prompt is presented. This redirection doesn't happen on the Confluence Cloud app.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the Confluence Cloud mobile app(we tested in Android)
 # Try to log in via your identity provider(IdP)

h3. Expected Results
 * User is informed of certificate issue with the IdP login page
 * The end-user is able to bypass the certificate error if they wish
 !Screenshot 2019-12-12 at 16.08.51.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
 * The login process hangs at the screen below:
 !Screenshot 2019-12-12 at 16.07.31.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
 * Use a mobile web browser
 * Make sure that your certificates are valid
fields.summary: Confluence Cloud mobile app does not allow users to bypass cert. errors - SSO via SAML is enabled

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, confluence has only Outbound SMTP Server to send notification and is not configurable.

h3. Proposed Solution

Allow custom mail servers or at least a relay where users could rewrite the sender's address
fields.summary: Support Custom Mail Server
Keyboard shortcut E start editing mode not necessarily on top of the page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Google Sheet embedded google docs sheets, (in the draft or published)the page keeps jumping up and down for 20 seconds, until all
embedded sheets are fully loaded, making the page unusable during all this time. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Embed multiple Google Docs sheets

h3. Expected Results
- Viewing or editing the page should not be affected when the page is trying to load the embedded sheets. 

h3. Actual Results
Page with embedded Google Docs keeps flickering until the Google Docs are fully loaded
 
h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Page with embedded Google Docs keeps flickering

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When attempting to export a page containing a huge number of JIRA Issue Macro, Confluence hit a timeout error and shows this error message:

{quote}
h2. *This site can't be reached.* 
The web page at https://apaccloudstg.atlassian.net/wiki/exportword?pageId=1234567 might be temporarily down or it may have moved permanently to a new web address.
{quote}

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Confluence Cloud page with more than 200 JIRA Issue macro
# Export page to Word

h3. Expected Results
Page gets exported

h3. Actual Results
Page timeout with this error:
 !screenshot-1.png|width=500! 

h3. Console log:
The 504 Gateway Timeout error on the endpoint - exportword?pageid=

h3. Notes
Similar to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-53097

h3. Workaround
Split the page or export using PDF export
fields.summary: Unable to export a page with a huge amount of JIRA Issue Macros to Word

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the new editor, it's not possible to add existing attachment that has been attached through the attachments page or by dragging and drop the file to the page (view mode) onto the editor

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud
* New editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page in the new editor
# Click on the "Files & Images" button.

h3. Expected Results
Allow selection of attachments from the existing attachment to be added to the page:
 !image-2019-12-12-09-03-00-776.png|width=450! 

h3. Actual Results
 !image-2019-12-12-09-03-26-258.png|width=450! 
No option to select from existing attachments
 
h3. Notes
We have a few similar requests raised before but the suggestion is to use the recent uploads but the recent uploads is showing only the attachments that we have uploaded, regardless any pages or spaces or even instances, but if the attachments are uploaded by some other user, we wouldn't be able to see the existing attachments that have been attached on the ticket.

Basically this request is to bring back the upload feature to call the attached file from the attachments page.

h3. Workaround
Go to the attachment's page of the page and download the files. Reattach the files o the editor.
fields.summary: Allow adding existing attachments on the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As an anonymous user I can't get data from /wiki/rest/api/search?cql= when filtering on type=blogpost and expand=content.space (or any other content expand)

Example: [https://mariatestarprod.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/search?cql=type=blogpost&limit=5&start=0&expand=content.space]

However if we remove the expand it works: [https://mariatestarprod.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/search?cql=type=blogpost&limit=5&start=0]

For pages the expand works as expected for anonymous users: [https://mariatestarprod.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/search?cql=type=page&limit=5&start=0&expand=content.space]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure you have a space that is accessible for anonymous users.
 # Add a blog post to the space
 # As an anonymous user access this rest point /wiki/rest/api/search?cql=type=blogpost&limit=5&start=0&expand=content.space

h3. Expected Results

The blog post with expanded data
h3. Actual Results

A 500 error saying

 
{code:java}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: start cannot be less than zero{code}
 
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: CQL rest api doesn't work when filter on blogpost and expand=content.space

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The *Expand* macro has been recently changed: instead of a highlighted blue and clickable link, it is faded, broad and grey button that occupies more space in the page.
h3. Suggestion
 * Let this new expand smaller;
 * Let it highlighted in somehow (the old one is more perceptible in the page, while this one seems something not clickable, as if it is greyed out);
 * Reduces the amount of blank space before and after the macro
 * Remove the gray border when expanding the macro
fields.summary: Expand macro layout changing

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The pages with a Page Layout and exported to PDF are having the margins cut off(except the content inside the layout). This is happening in pages built using the new editor.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page in the new editor;
 # Add text to the page;
 # Add a Page Layout with content inside it and publish the page;
 # Export the published page to PDF;
 # Notice that the text outside

h3. Expected Results

The output file should show all the text. 
!Screen Shot 2019-12-11 at 16.20.47.png|width=200! !Screen Shot 2019-12-11 at 16.21.38.png|width=200! 
h3. Actual Results

The margins of the output file are being cut off.
 !Screen Shot 2019-12-11 at 16.15.09.png|width=200! !Screen Shot 2019-12-11 at 16.17.25.png|width=295,height=96!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Pages exported to PDF with page Layouts inside it are cutting off the text margins

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Searching for key word within the content of a macro (like draw.io) does not show the draw.io diagram in the result. Switching the filter to "draw.io diagrams" gives back the result that is expected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install draw.io add-on
 # Create pages with draw.io diagram
 # Try to search for the page/diagram by using key word that is part of the content of the diagram in advanced search


h3. Expected Results

Diagrams shown as part of the advanced search result (all content)

h3. Actual Results

Only shows up in "draw.io Diagrams" filtered result


h3. Workaround

Use the "draw.io diagrams" filter or "include archived space" filter
fields.summary: Advanced Search (All content) no longer show draw.io results

fields.description:
It is at the moment not possible to display a single Jira Issue with the Jira Issue Macro and hide the Summary.

 

Here is it reported as bug in the documentation  https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-68822

 

But it would be better not to correct the documentation but implement this behavior for Confluence Cloud. (If I create a Jira Issue from a Confluence Text the item is displayed without a summary, so the functionality seems to be there, I just need a switch to toggle it).
fields.summary: Disable Summary for Jira Issue Macro displaying only one item

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Mac OS font character of multi-byte is missing when using PDF macro.
 This occurs in both the new editor and the old one.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upload [^sample.pdf]
 # Insert [^sample.pdf] with PDF macro
 # Publish

h3. Expected Results

It shows all character like the image below
 !スクリーンショット 2019-12-11 17.44.51.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

MacOS fonts for multi-byte character are missing like the image below. This occurs when you exported the PDF file with [Keynote|https://www.apple.com/keynote/].
 !スクリーンショット 2019-12-11 17.43.25.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Use PowerPoint to export PDF if applicable. Or replace [cmap|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cmap_(font)] in the PDF file as follows:
{code:bash}
# Mac (BSD)
$ LANG=C LC_ALL=C sed -i '' -e 's#/Registry (Adobe) /Ordering (Japan1) /Supplement [0-9]#/Registry(Adobe) /Ordering(Identity) /Supplement 0#g' CONFCLOUD-68832.bsd.pdf

# Linux (GNU)
$ LANG=C LC_ALL=C sed -ie 's#/Registry (Adobe) /Ordering (Japan1) /Supplement [0-9]#/Registry(Adobe) /Ordering(Identity) /Supplement 0#g' CONFCLOUD-68832.gnu.pdf
{code}
 * Keynote file: [^CONFCLOUD-68832.key] 
 * Original file: [^CONFCLOUD-68832.pdf]
 * Replaced with BSD sed: [^CONFCLOUD-68832.bsd.pdf]
 * Replaced with GNU sed: [^CONFCLOUD-68832.gnu.pdf]
fields.summary: Mac OS font character of multi-byte is missing when using PDF macro.

fields.description: Following the Jira Cloud for Mac app ([https://www.atlassian.com/blog/jira-software/jira-cloud-app-for-mac]), it would be helpful to have a native Confluence Cloud experience for MacOS. Mac users have already been asking for this experience across Community and other Atlassian channels.
fields.summary: Native MacOS App (Catalyst) for Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we are working with decimal numbers on Confluence, as like milliseconds for example, copying *0.78s* and pasting it calls a numbered list.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page;
# Type "_0.78s_" (or even "_0.banana_");
# Copy the content you just insert;
# Paste it anywhere in the page.

h3. Expected Results
The content is pasted.

h3. Actual Results
The content is pasted as a numbered list, changing the 0 (zero) for 1.

*NOTES*
* it happens with all the numbers. For example: try to reproduce it with _9.banana_, or _4.banana_ - the bug will occur. Trying it as 

h3. Workaround
We must manually type the string.
fields.summary: Copying a string that starts with "0." and pasting it calls a numbered list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a calendar have multiple event types (custom or default), the ICS import will only contain a single event type. All the different event types are merged in one.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a calendar on Team Calendars
# Create two event types
# Add events for both event types
# export the calendar to an iCalendar (ics)
# Import the calendar on any calendar client or to a different space

h3. Expected Results
All events and event types should be exported

h3. Actual Results
The events are exported but the event types are merged in a single one

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior other than move all events into a single event type before exporting the calendar. A different workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: ICS Import of a Team Calendar with multiple event types results in a calendar with just one event type

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we try to follow the documentation on the Jira Issues Macro, a number of options are not present for Confluence Cloud, only Self-hosted.

For example, this excerpt:
{quote}You can choose to show just the issue key, or the issue key and a summary. Select the macro placeholder and choose Show Summary or Hide Summary.
{quote}
This option is not available in the new Editor (Fabric), only the old one (tinyMCE).

These are the options in tinyMCE:

!tinyMCEOptions.jpg|width=453,height=230!

and these are the options in Fabric:

!FabricOptions.jpg|width=423,height=76!

There is no workaround, documentation points to another editor environment.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Try following the explanation about the macro functionality
h3. Expected Results

All functionalities explained there are correct and present in the macro
h3. Actual Results

Parts of the documentation are not correct
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

 

Suggested Resolution

Update the documentation in a way that both environments (Fabric and tinyMCE) are explained. This could probably be done by segmentation of the content displayed within the document.
fields.summary: Jira Issues Macro for Confluence Cloud documentation needs to be updated

fields.description: When exporting a Confluence Space to HTML, all attachments for each page will show at the end of the HTML page, as a list. This suggestion is to show the attachments in the HTML file in the same place they were uploaded on the Confluence page.
fields.summary: Attachments in the space export to HTML

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary In cases of pages where indentation is present inside tables and when these pages are migrated to fabric, fabric editor breaks because of migration bug. Example of such a table snippet - {code:java}

List all Funder Types for Client Individual

leave blank if no invoices in scope

{code} h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create page in legacy editor # Create a table which has indent in it # Migrate the page/space to latest editor  h3. Expected Results The page should show normally  h3. Actual Results Customer sees the page above with whole body as "Unsupported content" when at view mode. Edit mode shows all content but the table which has indents , appears frozen to edit h3. Workaround NA
fields.summary: Pages that have indentation in tables break after moving to latest editor experience

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

I've written a huge comment, then clicked another comment time to get a link to it. It used to just update url, now it reloads.

The real problem is that **_after page reloading my comment is lost._  And there is not even a blocking alert which'd say "Your comment will be lost, Continue?"

This is a real pain and time waster. I think for customers as well. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Type some new comment
 # Click on another comment's time to get a link to it. Or just reload the page

h3. Expected Results

Draft of the comment is saved (same as in Jira)

Or at least alert is shown where I can cancel page from reloading
h3. Actual Results

Page reloads, comment is lost, cannot restore it
h3. Workaround

-
fields.summary: Comment draft is not saved on page reload. There is no alert which says "Your comment will be lost"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While creating pages from templates (custom or default ones), if we click on a *Placeholder text*, at the beginning of the Placeholder sentence, it is not possible to edit the page unless we click on another place forward the placeholder text.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page selecting a template that has Placeholder text;
 # Click at the beginning of the placeholder's sentence;
 # Start to type.

h3. Expected Results

The placeholder text disappears and your text is shown up.
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens.

*Notes*[^CONFCLOUD-68811.mp4]

 
h3. Workaround

Place your mouse cursor further in the placeholder text (see the video).
fields.summary: Cannot edit a page created from a template after clicking over a placeholder text

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating content using the mobile app of Confluence Cloud, we do not have the ability to add a new table or edit a table that already exists on that page.

It would add great value to this feature if we could have the ability to insert and edit tables while using the mobile app.
fields.summary: Support tables on the mobile app

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, it is not possible to use the date macro calling *//* while editing/creating a new page on the Confluence Cloud app. 

This feature request suggests adding this as an usable option on the mobile app.
fields.summary: Support the date macro // on the mobile app

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While using Confluence in the mobile, it is not possible to edit pages when we are accessing it via a mobile browser (Safari/Google Chrome), on Android or iOS.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a mobile browser and access your Confluence site;
# Go to a page and try to edit it.

h3. Expected Results
The editing option is shown up.

h3. Actual Results
No option to edit the page is prompted.

h3. Workaround
Switch the browser to use the desktop version of Confluence.
fields.summary: Cannot access editing mode on pages using mobile browser

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When multiple Jira "Gadget" macros (particularly, the "Agile wallboard gadget" and the ‘Jira Issues Calendar’ macro) the gadget macros that are below will end up with a reduced viewable area without being able to scroll through to see the full rendered output.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add an Agile Wallboard gadget to the page that renders content about 15 or more issues tall.
 # copy and paste that gadget directly below the first one.
 # Publish the page

Note that you can reproduce this effect with the Jira Issues Calendar macro as well. The effect works with any combination of the Jira issues calendar and agile wallboard gadget.

h3. Expected Results
Both gadgets render their full content.

h3. Actual Results
The lower gadget will not render the full content and the are that can bee viewed does not scroll.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira "gadget" macros limit the size of other "gadget" macros on page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a free-tier user creates a new page or edits an existing page using iOS mobile application, user gets *Forbidden* error on publishing page. The changes will be applied anyway.
h3. Environment
 * Cloud
 * iOS mobile application

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create blank page on desktop

 * Edit page on iOS (phone or iPad)

 * Tap publish

 * Get "Forbidden" error

h3. Expected Results

The page publishes with out any error, _or_ no changes to published content.
h3. Actual Results

Changes are present, users are only able to tap X and "Discard changes" even though the changes are actually present.
h3. Workaround

No known workaround.
fields.summary: [iOS] Free tier users getting Forbidden error when publishing but publishes are successful

fields.description:
In the old editor you could align images (eg status bar macro), but with the new one you can only align text. 

Can the ability to align images be brought back please so we can move them from the default centre

!image-2019-12-09-12-46-58-685.png!
fields.summary: No longer able to align images

fields.description:
h3.Summary

Currently, in the new editor, we cannot add Note macro within the Numbering List, if added, the numbering format will starts back to 1 after the macro.

h3. Suggested Solution

Ability to add the Note macro within the numbered list.
fields.summary: Ability to add Note macro within Numbered List

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When attempted to view a previous version of a page from page history, the page is still showing the current version.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page and publish it
# Edit it, make some changes and publish it again, so you can have 2 versions of the same page
# Go to Page History
# Click on the link to first version (v. 1)

h3. Expected Results
The page loads the old content in v.1 before making the changes.

h3. Actual Results
The page is loading the current version of the page.

h3. Additional Notes
Same behaviour in both old and new Confluence editors.

h3. Workaround
Open the old version link in a new browser tab.
fields.summary: View a previous version of a page loads the current version

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Not all like buttons are removed from Confluence page when setting is disabled

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Further Configuration setting:
 https://<cloudsite>.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/viewspacesconfig.action
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
 # Uncheck Enable Likes

h3. Setting enabled (/) (all like buttons visible)
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Setting disabled (x) (still showing like button)
!2019-12-08_13-59-05 (2).png|thumbnail! :


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Disabling page likes not working as intended

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, in order for a user to access a certain child page inside of a page tree, the user must navigate through the tree until the specific page is found

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an option to expand all pages by default.
fields.summary: Option to automatically expand all pages on the sidebar's page tree

fields.description: comments icons in popular page should link to the comments section of that article
fields.summary: comments icons in popular page should link to the comments section of that article

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

An error is returning when adding the activity stream gadget or the confluence page gadget on a Confluence page.
It affects both editors and on some instance it is not showing at all to be selected.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a blank or existing page;
 # Add the activity stream macro /activity {activity
 # Save/Insert the macro

h3. Expected Results

You're able to add the activity stream macro.
h3. Actual Results

When trying to insert the macro, the error in the preview/save/insert is shown:

{quote}Error rendering macro 'gadget' : The gadget at https:/instance.atlassian.net/wikirest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.streams.confluence:activitystream-gadget/gadgets/conf-activitystream-gadget.xml was not added to this Confluence instance yet.
{quote}

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Gadget macros are not working/returning error
Include Page macro doesn't keep the colored cells from a table
Page Properties Report wraps the columns depending on the screen's width
Switching browser tabs cancel the opened Placeholder's text input box

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A page that the user has not worked on before appears on top of the "Your Work" list when accessing via the IOS mobile app. The issue happening for specific users only.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Login to confluence via IOS confluence app
 

h3. Expected Results

Users should see the latest page they worked on.

h3. Actual Results

Users seeing the page they have not worked on appearing.

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: A page that user has not worked on before appears on top of "Your Work" list

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when a non-admin tried to access a direct link to Manage apps https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/servlet/upm it will redirect the non-admin user to a 404 error page. 

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be more helpful if it will give an unauthorized error when a non-admin tried to access Manage apps direct link.
fields.summary: Helpful error when a non-admin tried to access Manage Apps direct link

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When rendering a page as full-width in the new editor, there's a large amount of whitespace on both the left and the right side. 

Users want to be able to use full-width so their pages utilize as much horizontal space as the page allows. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page in the new Confluence editor.
 # Switch to *Make page full-width*. 
 # Make sure your browser window is maximized to the full page so you can see the amount of whitespace that is left behind.

h3. Expected Results

The page should stretch from one side of the editor window to the other.
h3. Actual Results

In this case, there's a large amount of unused space.

!CleanShot 2019-12-06 at 11.30.48.png|width=733,height=157!
h3. Workaround

No current workaround.
fields.summary: Making page full-width does not render page as full-width

fields.description:
There's already a Server request for this; we'd love to see it in Cloud.

We use calendars in Confluence for a lot of different things, but one of them is to display Jira issues from our vacation request project. We cannot force the user to include their name in the summary field, so I'd really like it if we could customize which fields display in a given Confluence calendar, so we could include Reporter instead of Summary for this particular project's calendar.
fields.summary: Allow customization of Jira issues in Team Calendars

fields.description:
When a Confluence user comes across a restricted page, it is unclear how to request access to that page. Please see this community post for reference - https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/How-does-quot-Request-access-quot-work-in-Confluence/qaq-p/433276. 

It would be helpful to see the page/space owner displayed so that users can contact them directly to request access. 

Additionally, the current UI is not clear that you can click on the displayed icon to request access.
fields.summary: Request page access on restricted pages

fields.description:

Currently, if you have a numbered list and added a table in between. The numbering format will starts back to 1 after the table.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you click on an embedded link URL, for example, through a chat link on Instagram and attempts to open it, the page will open while you're still on instagram, but the images on it will not load on iOS.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Share an URL page with anonymous access enabled with images on it
 # Share this link on e-mail or instagram chat
 # Open the URL on your phone through the e-mail app (gmail for example) or the instagram chat.
 # Scroll the page to see the page and images

h3. Expected Results

The page and images will load normally as you were accessing it on the mobile browser or on desktop.
h3. Actual Results

The images does not load, only the page.

It does not affects mobile browser (Chrome, Safari)
h3. Workaround

Access the URL directly on the mobile browser.
fields.summary: Loading images in pages open to anonymous access are not working if the URL is accessed through an embedded  link on Mobile

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When pasting single digit decimal numbers into the new editor (either from an external source or even from the old editor), the 1st digit is replaced with a numbered list.
h4. Example
{quote}1.5 -> 1. 5

3.6 -> 1. 6

5.7 -> 1. 7
{quote}
Clicking off the *Numbered List* button in the editor does _not_ correct the issue. It will simply remove the numbered list and leave only the digits after the decimal. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 #  Create a page in the new editor
 # Create a page in the old editor
 # Make a list of single decimal digits (e.g. 4.5, 2.7, 3.6, etc.) (Does not need to be a list, can be a single number.)
 # Copy the numbers, and paste them into the page on the new editor.

h3. Expected Results

Numbers should be pasted without formatting into a numbered list.
h3. Actual Results

The numbers will automatically be converted into a numbered list.
h4. Old Editor:

!old-editor.png|width=314,height=238!
h4. New Editor:

!new-editor.png|width=213,height=149!
h3. Workaround

Pasting directly into a code snippet does retain the original values. In addition, copying from a raw text editor also appears to work.

h3. Notes

* Many users may report this as an issue with copying and pasting tables from Excel, or tables from pages that are using the Old Editor.
* I can confirm that the issue persists without pasting from a table or list. You could paste a single number and it will still auto-convert.
* Pasting without formatting (e.g. CMD+SHIFT+OPTION+V on macOS) does _not_ work to avoid the formatting.
* Clicking off on Numbered List only will remove the numbered list, but will not correct the issue (i.e. 5.7 which has been changed to 1. 7 will only revert back to 7)
* Attempted to disable auto-formatting in personal editor settings, but no change.
fields.summary: Pasting single digit decimal numbers in new editor results in numbered list replacing the first digit

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There are a few macros that are available in the new editor, but they only appear when using the */* shortcut, and not in the macro browser search ( *+ > . . . View More*) 

Examples:
 * Panel Macro (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-67435)
 * Status Macro

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a page using the new editor, click *+ > . . . View More* to pull up the macro browser.
 # Search for *Status*. You will see that the Status macro is not available.
 # Go back to the page, and type */Status* instead. You will find the Status macro is available.

h3. Expected Results

All available macros in the new editor should be available both from the *View More* menu, and from the */* shortcut.
h3. Actual Results

It's only possible to embed these macros into a page using the */* shortcut.

!CleanShot 2019-12-04 at 11.30.59.png|thumbnail!

!CleanShot 2019-12-04 at 11.31.06.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Insert macros using the */* shortcut.
fields.summary: Some available macros missing from macro browser search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you use an add-on like Gliffy or Draw.io Diagram, you can choose to add the add-on to the sidebar menu. This will list all the Diagrams in the space. If you have more than 20 diagrams, the link after the 20th diagram will be incorrect. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install an add-on (Gliffy or Draw.io)
# Access Space Settings > Sidebar Configuration > Choose to show the add-on 
# Create more than 20 Diagrams in the space 
# Access the Add-on Sidebar menu to see all the list of diagrams created in the space 
# Access the diagrams after the 20th diagram

h3. Expected Results
- Accessing the links of the diagrams listed the add-ons Sidebar menu should be working. 

h3. Actual Results
- First 20 diagrams will show the correct link: https://<domain>.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/servlet/ac/com.mxgraph.confluence.plugins.diagramly/
- Link after the 20th diagram is incorrect: https://<domain>.atlassian.net/wiki/wiki/plugins/servlet/ac/com.mxgraph.confluence.plugins.diagramly/

h3. Workaround
- Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Incorrect link is shown when viewing the add-ons from the Sidebar menu

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Kaspersky Internet Security's Web Antivirus Extension causing pages to freeze on Confluence Cloud. When a user tries to edit a page in the New Editor the tab becomes unresponsive (CPU 100%)
 
h3. How to Replicate
# Install Kaspersky Internet Security and Enable Web Antivirus Extension
  >  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
# Go to https://<cloudsite>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<spacekey>/pages/edit-v2/<pageid> 
# Open Chrome task manager and notice how the CPU spikes to 100% after 10-15seconds
# Tab freezes:

*Expected Results:*
* Able to edit page with Web Antivirus enabled

*Actual results:*
* Unable to edit page with Web Antivirus enabled

h3. Workaround
* Currently, the workaround is to disable the Web Antivirus Extension as it interferes with the Confluence editing experience and it's not something we have control of.
fields.summary: Kaspersky Internet Security's Web Antivirus Extension causing pages to freeze on Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Confluence, if the user restricts a page for groups with an uppercase letter, members of the group will not be able to find the page on the sidebar, or, search for the same while using the quick search feature.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# As a *site-admin* of the application, make sure to create a new group that will be using uppercase letters through [https://site.atlassian.net/admin]. For example, "testiNG".
# With the created group (and also, the *Application Access* granted for the same, if needed), make sure to add specific users to the same.
# Now, in Confluence, access a child page from the Home page of a space and *restrict* the same for the created group.
# Ask one of the group members to access the page by sending the link
# Ask them to check the sidebar and also, try to search for it.

h3. Expected Results
The page should be searchable and displayed in the correct hierarchy on the sidebar.

h3. Actual Results
Only the Home page link is displayed on the sidebar and the page is not findable. If expanding the home link, the page will not be listed.

h3. Workaround
Either add the users to a new group that will not use uppercase letters or, individually add the users to the page restriction.
fields.summary: Restricted pages do not display in the sidebar/search when a user has access to them through a group with an uppercase letter on its name

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* When using the Page tree Macro in the new Editor, if we configure the macro with root as @self and without any search and the child page titles with the same length, when published, a new line is added.
* Macro wraps based on the longest entry, but even when the title is short (with search and no search configuration).
* Bullet point located on the top of the page tree results.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Add the Page tree macro, with Search & without Search.
* Set root as @self
* Add the child pages with the same title
* Add the child pages with longer titles

h3. Expected Results

* Page tree macro results are displayed correctly

h3. Actual Results

* A new line when all child pages have same title length 
* Macro wraps based on the longest entry, but even when the title is short (with search and no search)

h3. Workaround

Can use Content by Label macro to list all the child pages, by adding the same label.
fields.summary: Page tree macro CSS problem
Improve Advanced Search in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
- Currently, the 'Simple' option will only display the first line of the text contained in an Excerpt macro. It will not include any status macro inside the Excerpt macro 

h3. Suggested Solution
- When using Children Display Macro, Include Excerpts (Simple) should include status macro inside Excerpt

Use Case
{panel}
We would like to use the "simple" option instead of the "Rich content" because we prefer the compact one-line result of the first one.
More in detail, the "Children" macro would be used to list a lot of child pages, so the "simple" option would make the result much more compact and readable.
{panel}
fields.summary: When using Children Display Macro, Include Excerpts (Simple) should include status macro inside Excerpt

Thanks a bunch!

 

Anton Erholt

Data Engineer @ Epidemic Sound

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we are subscribed to a space or even to all the new blog posts on our site, once the space is updated with a new page, or a new blog post is created, we do receive the notification email, but not the in-app notification (red dot on the bell icon:  !image-2019-12-02-17-24-28-954.png|width=27,height=22! )
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log in on Confluence;
 # Open an incognito window on your browser and log is as another user (or ask a teammate to log in on Confluence);
 # This other user must add a page, blog post or comment on a space you watch.

h3. Expected Results

You receive an in-app notification in the Confluence UI.
h3. Actual Results

You only receive the notification email.

*Notes*:
 * If the other user @mention yours, the in-app notification appears;
 * Once you are mentioned on a comment/page/blog post, you start to receive notifications - it is like that once you get mentioned, then you are truly watching that content;
 * Plus, the notification neither appear when we click over the bell icon, though we receive them as an email message.

h3. Workaround

For the in-app notification, there is no much we can do, but as we are receiving the email notifications, we can use them for now.
fields.summary: In-app notifications (the bell icon) not being received

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we try to create a `Documentation Space` or a `Team Space`, intermittently, an error is displayed on the screen. The space is actually created.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to *Space Directory*
 # Click *Create Space*
 # Select *Documentation Space*
 # Click *Create*

h3. Expected Results

Space is created.
h3. Actual Results

An error message is displayed, UI gets stuck but the space is created.

Notes -

Whenever we try to create a documentation space, the following error message is displayed:

*```We can't create that blueprint right now.*
 Hibernate operation: could not execute statement; sql=n/a; SQL []; ERROR: update or delete on table "content" violates foreign key constraint "fkwjyn6091q3l1gl7bh143ma2a" on table "content" Detail: Key (contentid)=(508461219) is still referenced from table "content".; nested exception is org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: update or delete on table "content" violates foreign key constraint "fkwjyn6091q3l1gl7bh143ma2a" on table "content" Detail: Key (contentid)=(508461219) is still referenced from table "content"```
h3. Workaround

The space is actually created, so refreshing the page will get things back to normal.
fields.summary: Creating a Space from Documentation Spaces Blueprint throws an Error Message

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently {{AP.request()}} calls made from Connnect macros when displayed via the Jira Service Desk customer portal do not allow for unlicensed users (which JSD customers usually are) to make POST requests to Confluence APIs.

h3. Suggested Solution
AP.request() calls made from Connect macros shown in the JSD customer portal to be allowed using the same unlicensed Confluence behaviour that applied for GET requests.

h3. Workaround
Vendors can make the POST requests from their application server, rather than using {{AP.request()}} to make an impersonated request from the client-side.

h3. Notes
The current solution for unlicensed users viewing Confluence content, including macros, from the Jira Service Desk customer portal strictly allows only read access to Confluence. For this reason, supporting GET requests from Confluence macros is mostly sufficient. The exception is any POST request that only requires read permission like https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-api-contentbody-convert-to-post
fields.summary: Connect macro content not viewable via Jira Service Desk customer portal knowledge-base

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Inserting files into comment sections ends with broken media placeholders.
Reported by customer here: https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/JST-533196


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As a user, I create a new page
 # I enter any content and title and click PUBLISH
 # Then I wait for the page to load
 # Then I click page comment section to create a new comment.
 # and drag-and-drop a file (attachment) on the comment editor
 # and see the file being uploaded.
 # After I publish the comment I see the file in the comment.
 # Then I reload the page.

h3. Expected Results

The attachment is visible in the comment and I can see thumbnail, can click it and download it.
h3. Actual Results

After reloading the page I see a broken attachment placeholder in the comment
!image-20191129-044933.png|width=150,height=121!
*Recording*

!comment attachments bug.gif!
h3. Workaround
 # Click EDIT on the comment.

 # Reload the whole page !https://api.media.atlassian.com/file/2fc0cafa-cdaf-4649-bcc1-bc5bcd36da58/image?collection=emoji-site-a436116f-02ce-4520-8fbb-7301462a1674&width=64&height=64&max-age=31536000|width=20,height=20!

 # The attachment now loads correctly

*Investigation*

When the attachment fails to load I see a 401 status for POST https://api.media.atlassian.com/items

with message:

{code}
{"code":"JwtAuthoriser:AuthorisationError",
 "title":
   "The token does not allow requested operation . 
   \"urn:filestore:file:c219841f-ff67-4e6a-bcf6-0f3e79a9d535\" 
   needs \"read\" permission"
  }
{code}

The request contains something like:

{code}
{"descriptors":[
  {
    "type":"file",
    "id":"8013c6b7-abb4-4576-85d8-23f3e0a809bc"
  }
]}
{code}

but should contain:
{code}
{"descriptors":[
  {
    "type":"file",
    "id":"8013c6b7-abb4-4576-85d8-23f3e0a809bc",
    "collection":"contentId-589847937"
  }
]}
{code}

(notice the missing collection property)

When inspecting the graphql response from backend, it sends back ADF for the comment, but the media nodes have {{collection: null}} in them (while they should contain a string in the format {{contentId-000000}}). Maybe the ADF marshaller is not working correctly?
fields.summary: Attaching media on page comments yields invalid ADF and doesn't show files.

fields.description:

|  !image-2019-11-29-21-21-49-899.png|thumbnail! | !image-2019-11-29-21-21-45-294.png|thumbnail! |

h3. Workaround
No other workaround besides aligning the text to the left.
fields.summary: Headings have no margin when the text is center aligned

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

With the latest [editing improvements|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html], some macros (such as anchor links) are no more supported, and have alternatives (Linkable headings). But, it is not possible to convert automatically the pages containing these deprecated macros to their alternatives.

In fact, when converting the old experience pages to new experience one, we need to manually edit them. 
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide ability to automatically convert old editor pages with deprecated macros to new editor pages with alternative features.
h3. Workaround

For now, this can only be done by manually editing the pages containg the deprecated macros.
fields.summary: Ability to automatically convert old editor pages with deprecated macros to new editor pages with alternative features

fields.description:
Currently, it is only possible to let a draft page publishable with other users if we use the *Collaborative Editing*.

This suggestion purposes that all the drafts on a space turn publishable with all users in the space that have *add* pages permission in the space (in case this draft is restricted, then only the users listed in the restrictions will be able to publish it).
fields.summary: Let a draft page publishable to all users with *add* pages permission in the space

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Inserting files into comment sections ends with broken media placeholders.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As a user, I create a new page
 # I enter any content and title and click PUBLISH
 # Then I wait for the page to load
 # Then I click page comment section to create a new comment.
 # and drag-and-drop a file (attachment) on the comment editor
 # and see the file being uploaded.
 # After I publish the comment I see the file in the comment.
 # Then I reload the page.

h3. Expected Results
Attachments are always available and accessible

h3. Actual Results
After reloading the page I see a broken attachment placeholder in the comment (the attachment is still visible and can be downloaded via the "page attachments" page)
 !image-20191129-044933.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Click EDIT on the comment containing broken thumbnails, and then reload the page (no need to save the comment).
fields.summary: Attaching files to page comments doesn't work
